(-23 AMENDMENT) AIRCRAFT WRECKAGE DISCOVERED BY SURVEY TEAM ON YAKIMA INDIAN NATION NEAR TOPPENISH WASHINGTON. AIRCRAFT REPORTED MISSING ON 01/08/1983 ON A FLIGHT FROM YAKIMA, WA TO LONG BEACH, CA. AFTER 22 PLUS YEARS OF NATURES ACTIONS, THE LARGEST PIECE OF AIRCRAFT WAS REPORTED TO BE ABOUT 2 FEET SQUARE. THE BONES OF THE TWO OCCUPANTS WERE TO BE COLLECTED BY THE CORONER. ACCIDENT SITE AT ELEVATION OF 5437 FEET IN VERY RUGGED TERRAIN. THE ACCIDENT SITE WAS NOT VISITED. NUMBER IN 1983 WAS SEA83FAMS2.

THE ISLAP CONTROLLER COORDINATED THE DIVERSION WITH THE FARMINGDALE/REPUBLIC TOWER & TOLD THE PLT TO EXPECT A BACK COURSE ILS APCH TO RWY 32. ALSO, HE TOLD THE PLT TO CHANGE TO NY APCH CONTROL & SAID THEY WOULD HAVE FARMINGDALE'S WX & WOULD PROVIDE VECTORS. THE PLT CONTACTED APCH CONTROL, BUT DID NOT INQUIRE FURTHER ABOUT THE WX, NOR DID APCH CONTROL PROVIDE IT. THE CONTROLLER VECTORED THE PLTTHRU THE LOCALIZER, THEN BACK TO IT. THE PLT WAS CLEARED FOR THE APCH & WAS INSTRUCTED TO CONTACT THE TOWER AT 1 1/2 MI FROM THE FINAL APCH FIX (FAF). HE HAD DIFFICULTY TURNING ONTO THE LOCALIZER & BEGAN A MISSED APCH APRX 2 MI AFTER PASSING THE FAF. HIS INTENTION WAS STILL TO LAND AT FARMINGDALE. HE WAS INSTRUCTED TO CLIMB TO 2000 FT & WAS PROVIDED VECTORS FOR ANOTHER APCH. HOWEVER, HE DID NOT MAINTAIN ALT & SUBSEQUENTLY CRASHED IN A MARSH. NO PREIMPACT FAILURE FND.

19830909048129A	AIRCRAFT DISAPPEARED FROM RADAR 13 MILES EAST OF KALISPELL VOR. AIRCRAFT HAS NOT BEEN LOCATED. (-23) ACCIDENT PILOT WAS REPORTED TO BE IN AN AREA OF INTENSE THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY AND WAS ATTEMPTING TO RETURN OVER THE MOUNTAINS, BACK TO THE KALISPELL AIRPORT. THE ACCIDENT SITE WAS LOCATED NEAR THE BOTTOM OF A STEEP, HEAVILY TREED, RAVINE. TWO PINE TREES WERE MISSING THEIR TOPS AT APPROX. 30 FEET FROM GROUND LEVEL AND ONE CONTAINED A PIECE OF LEFT WING TIP. THE MAIN WRECKAGE WAS 30 FEET AND ON A BEARING OF 050 FROM THE TWO, TOPPED, TREES. THE ENGINE AND FUSELAGE WERE IN-LINE ON A BEARING OF 310. THE ENGINE WAS IMPACTED IN THE GROUND AT APPROX. 80 DEGREES NOSE DOWN. CABIN AREA FIRE WAS EVIDENT. REMAINS OF THE WINGS, LIFT STRUTS, AND FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES WERE FOUND IN THEIR APPROXIMATE RESPECTIVE POSITIONS. NOTE: THIS AIRCRAFT HAD BEEN REPORTED AS  "MISSING" SINCE LAST CONTACT WITH THE PILOT WAS MADE ON 9 SEPTEMBER, 1983. HIKERS IN THE AREA DISCOVERED THE WRECKAGE IN AUGUST 2002.

19840127001659A	AIRCRAFT WHEEL FOUND FLOATING IN LAKE. PILOT HAD BEEN KNOWN TO SKIP WHEELS ON LAKE. WRECKAGE, AND BODIES NOT FOUND. AMENDED DATE: 06/13/2008 ON JANUARY 27,1984, N3829D, A BEECHCRAFT SKIPPER BE-77, DEPARTED THE TRADEWIND AIRPORT (KTDW) IN AMARILLO, TEXAS FOR A TWO HOUR LOCAL FLIGHT OPERATED BY ^PRIVACY DATA OMITTED^ WITH PASSENGER ^PRIVACY DATA OMITTED^ ABOARD. THE AIRCRAFT NEVER RETURNED. ON JANUARY 28, 1984 THE RIGHT WHEEL OF THE AIRCRAFT WAS FOUND FLOATING IN LAKE MEREDITH NEAR FRITCH, TEXAS, MATCHED THE PART NUMBER FROM THE MISSING AIRCRAFT. ON JANUARY 29, 1984 A JACKET SIMILAR TO ONE WORN BY THE PILOT WAS FOUND FLOATING IN THE LAKE. A SEARCH WAS CONDUCTED FROM JANUARY 28 TO FEBRUARY 2, 1984 WITH NO SUCCESS. ON MAY 31, 2008 THE AIRCRAFT WRECKAGE WAS DISCOVERED IN LAKE MEREDITH AND REPORTED TO THE U.S. PARK SERVICE, WHO ALSO NOTIFIED THE NTSB. THE ONLY RESTRAINTS FOUND WERE TWO LAP BELTS AND THE PILOT'S SHOULDER HARNESS, ALL OF WHICH SHOWED SIGNS OF STRESS. EYEWITNESS REPORTS INDICATE SEEING AN AIRCRAFT MAKING NUMEROUS LOW PASSES OVER THE LAKE. IN AN AIRPORT BREAKROOM SOMETIME BEFORE THE ACCIDENT OCCURRED A COMMERCIAL PILOT OVERHEARD THE PILOT, ^PRIVACY DATA OMITTED^, BRAGGING BOUT SKIPPING HIS WHEELS IN LAKE MEREDITH. THE REMAINS OF THE PILOT AND PASSENGER HAVE NOT BEEN FOUND.
